text: Carphephorus corymbosus (common names Florida paintbrush and coastal plain chaffhead) is a species of North American plants in the sunflower family. They are native to the southeastern United States in the States of Florida, Georgia, and South Carolina.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map Carphephorus corymbosus is an herb up to 120 cm (4 feet) tall. It produces a flat-topped inflorescence with many small purplish flower heads containing disc florets but no ray florets.Flora of North America, Florida paintbrush, Carphephorus corymbosus (Nuttall) Torrey & A. Gray, Fl. N. Amer. 2: 67. 1841. == References == ==External links== *Florida Native Plant Society *Native Florida Wildflowers *Lady Bird Johnson Wildflower Center, University of Texas Category:Eupatorieae Category:Plants described in 1818 Category:Flora of the Southeastern United States
title: Carphephorus corymbosus
